actions.text: House Committee on Rules Reported an Original Measure. Report No: 100-113.
Called up by House as Privileged Matter.
Resolution Agreed to in House by Yea-Nay Vote: 397 - 0 (Record Vote No: 162).

official_title: A resolution providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 1934) to clarify the congressional intent concerning, and to codify, certain requirements of the Communications Act of 1934 that ensure that broadcasters afford reasonable opportunity for the discussion of conflicting views on issues of public importance.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for the consideration of H.R. 1934 (Fairness Doctrine).

titles.title: A resolution providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 1934) to clarify the congressional intent concerning, and to codify, certain requirements of the Communications Act of 1934 that ensure that broadcasters afford reasonable opportunity for the discussion of conflicting views on issues of public importance.
